message.content:
Below is one possible “breakdown” of how to re‐create the tower exactly as shown, using the dictionary blocks without any re‐orientation:

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Block Count and Layers  
  – There are 5 total blocks arranged in 3 layers.  
  – Bottom Layer (2 blocks): one green cube (left) + one blue cube (right).  
  – Second Layer (2 blocks): a green cube on the left stacked directly over the bottom green cube, and a red “arched” block spanning the center/right.  
  – Top Layer (1 block): a single flat green rectangular block covering the entire top.

• Spatial Relationships  
  – On the bottom layer, the green and blue cubes sit side by side.  
  – On the second layer, the green cube is directly above the green cube below; the red arched block sits above the blue cube and bridges partway over the green side, creating the half‐circular opening at the front.  
  – A single green rectangular block caps the top, resting on both second‐layer blocks.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE REQUIRED BLOCKS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
From the dictionary image, the matching pieces (by index) and how many times each is used:

• Green Cube  →  Index 9  (used twice)  
• Blue Cube   →  Index 8  (used once)  
• Red Arch    →  Index 4  (used once)  
  – Block #4 is the red arch oriented so that the half‐cylinder is visible from the front.  
• Green Flat Rectangular Block  →  Index 12  (used once)  
  – Block #12 is the green 2×1 block lying “flat,” matching the top layer.

Block Indices Needed:
[9, 9, 8, 4, 12]

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is an example order in which one might place them:

{
  Step1: Move block with index 9    (place first green cube at bottom left)
  Step2: Move block with index 8    (place blue cube at bottom right)
  Step3: Move block with index 9    (stack second green cube over the first)
  Step4: Move block with index 4    (place red arch over the blue cube/partly above green)
  Step5: Move block with index 12   (lay the flat green rectangular block on top)
}

This yields the exact tower seen in the target image.
